sentence: Did you hear about that glacier off the coast of Italy? It was a romaine iceberg
explanation: A large floating mass of ice
first_new_sentence: The iceberg broke off from the glacier and drifted into the ocean.
second_new_sentence: The scientist studied the iceberg to understand climate change.

sentence: What do you call a cow that just had a baby? de-calf-inated
explanation: The process of sucking air out of something
first_new_sentence: The barista de-calf-inated my coffee so I could sleep at night.
second_new_sentence: The scientist examined the de-calf-inated cow to ensure it was healthy after giving birth.

sentence: Where does Moses get his coffee? Hebrews it

sentence: Each word selected is a single word that maintains the same spelling but has two different meanings in the context of the jokes provided, and the serious sentences illustrate both meanings of the chosen words.
